title: What is the role of symbols in accessing higher consciousness and how do they operate in various levels of our being?
first_phrase: In this final segment, the author explores the power of symbols and how they can guide us towards higher states of consciousness. The use of symbols has been employed throughout history in politics, religion, and magic, but the author emphasizes that the true power of symbols lies in their ability to create a direct connection with higher realms of understanding and creation. Through specific exercises, the author suggests that we can awaken our senses and embark on a journey of personal evolution and transcendence. The author, Dr. Marco Paret, is a renowned expert in neuroscience and neurolinguistics, and the information is derived from his book “Oltre la Trance”.
content: Con una differenza essenziale però: mentre in politica ed in religione il simbolo fa appello all’amor di patria, alla passione di parte, alla fede ed al pregiudizio religioso, ossia unicamente al sentimento, di cui provoca I’esaltazione e la manifestazione; nella nostra disciplina il simbolo non fa mai appello al sentimento, sibbene alle capacità più elevate di comprensione e di creazione della mente e dello spirito. Il sentimento, le credenze, le teorie, il senso stesso di un qualunque inquadramento e subordinamento alla massa, sono elementi umani, ed è un errore basarsi sopra di essi o comunque patteggiare con essi quando si vuole trascendere a degli spazi superiori6. Articolo del dr. Marco Paret – Tratto dal libro “Oltre la Trance (http://www.neurolinguistic.com )
last_phrase: In conclusion, while politics and religion use symbols to appeal to emotions and prejudices, our discipline relies on the highest abilities of the mind and spirit for comprehension and creativity. It is crucial to transcend the limitations of human emotions, beliefs, and theories if we want to access superior realms. Therefore, in our pursuit of knowledge and growth, let us elevate ourselves beyond the confines of sentiment and embrace the power of our intellectual and spiritual faculties.
